document_data.caption: The Great Mosque of the Pantheon.
document_data.name: Great Mosque of the Pantheon
document_data.mainbody: The '''Great Mosque of the Pantheon''' was the center of [[Pantheist Enlightenment|Enlightenment]] within the [[Pantheist League]] of [[Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Location: The mosque was located in the city of [[I'tiraf]], the central capital of the Pantheist League.
document_data.Structure: The Great Mosque of the Pantheon was one of the largest structures in Zakhara found outside of [[Huzuz]]. The mosque's beauty was just as impressive as its scale. The mosque was made from carefully polished blue stone quarried from [[Al-Sayaj Mountains]]. The stone was inlaid with [[gold]] and set with precious [[gem]]s.
document_data.Activities: The Great Mosque of the Pantheon was considered a ''haram'' or holy site, attracting pilgrims from throughout the Pantheist League.
document_data.Defenses: The Great Mosque was guarded by [[mamluk]]s.
